title: How to Make Ice Cube Tray Diet Chocolate Cheesecake

steps.headline: Place clean/empty ice cube tray in the freezer approximately 2 to 4 hours before making cakes.
steps.description: The pre-frozen tray will set up the mini cheesecakes nicely and make for better freezing.

steps.headline: Combine cheesecake ingredients in a mixer on medium-low speed.
steps.description: Whip batter until smooth and creamy.

steps.headline: Mix the chocolate coating ingredients in a food processor and run until well combined.
Spray pre-frozen ice cube tray with non-stick cooking spray (butter flavored is preferred).
steps.description: You could also grease with the end of a stick of butter or another healthy oil.

steps.headline: Coat the bottom and sides of the ice cube tray inserts with chocolate.
steps.description: Don’t overfill but make sure the bottom and sides are well coated. Use a spoon or small rubber spatula to ensure each area is completely covered.

steps.headline: Pour cheesecake filling into each tray, filling each section approximately ¾ of the way.
Add another layer of chocolate coating to each mini cheesecake.
steps.description: Use only the allotted space and don’t overfill.

steps.headline: Place tray in freezer and freeze for 2 to 3 hours.
steps.description: Consider laying a sheet of parchment paper over the top of the tray in order to avoid co-mingling odors in the freezer.

steps.headline: Remove frozen cheesecakes by lightly twisting tray to release cake.

text: Place clean/empty ice cube tray in the freezer approximately 2 to 4 hours before making cakes. The pre-frozen tray will set up the mini cheesecakes nicely and make for better freezing. Combine cheesecake ingredients in a mixer on medium-low speed. Whip batter until smooth and creamy. Mix the chocolate coating ingredients in a food processor and run until well combined.  Spray pre-frozen ice cube tray with non-stick cooking spray (butter flavored is preferred). You could also grease with the end of a stick of butter or another healthy oil. Coat the bottom and sides of the ice cube tray inserts with chocolate. Don’t overfill but make sure the bottom and sides are well coated. Use a spoon or small rubber spatula to ensure each area is completely covered. Pour cheesecake filling into each tray, filling each section approximately ¾ of the way.  Add another layer of chocolate coating to each mini cheesecake. Use only the allotted space and don’t overfill. Place tray in freezer and freeze for 2 to 3 hours. Consider laying a sheet of parchment paper over the top of the tray in order to avoid co-mingling odors in the freezer. Remove frozen cheesecakes by lightly twisting tray to release cake.
